title: bronze spectate youtube?
body:
Hey guys
Does anyone know of any youtube channels that spectate bronze games and give commentary on what they did wrong?
There was a guy here on boards advertising but i seen all his now and looking for more

Something that points out what they did wrong and what they could do better so that i can watch take notes and get better?

replies.body:
When I did some coaching a while back I also started a video series which is along the lines of what you were wanting. Its me coaching players through their replays and talking about the zone potential, use of cooldowns etc. Ive only got a Lucian, Nami and Thresh that are Silver, I believe the rest are gold+ analysis. Unfortunately I had to stop the series as I've got 0.7 Upload and it ruined my net back then. I'm looking to continue on with this content sometime soon if my internet gets upgraded!

The videos were a while ago, so the build paths may have changed, but these champs have stayed relatively the same regardless, and a lot of the mechanical/positional aspects will still be worth noting.

I hope this helps! Give me some feedback if it helps! I may be able to do one for you in the near future. Feel free to add me and ask questions

[Thresh Game](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gy1nOHbkwQc)
[Nami Game](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ETpKiWEz5HI)
[Lucian Game](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=7ULRVDLZn8M)
[Ezreal [Gold V]](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qnAospDUgjY)
Yasei Doubutsu did a few of my games he really helped me check him out

Here's an [oce channel](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC8x_OF9Fo1vb8NkaASrXaXQ). You can even submit your videos to him (yasei doubutsu) and he can upload the vid with a commentary. - I guess he is the one you have already watched all the videos of. 

Fox drop does a couple
So does pants are dragon (he does really good guides in general)
Unfortunately, I cant think of/ find others. Most just aim to make fun of bronzies.

I think the best thing you can do is submit your recordings to Yasei. Watching people analyse other bronze games probably won't be all that relevant to you, as you may not be playing the same champs/ making the same mistakes as the other players.  Watching your own games would be way better as you can learn from your own mistakes.

I was about to submit myself, but thank you XD
You too Fitz, I know you gonna read this XD
Ive already watched all yours they were great, really helped

Thats good to know.
Im more then happy to try and do the same this if you wish. Maybe that will help even more.

Lol mate. You would have a heart attack watching my games
My biggest problem is im kind of a really bad jack of all trades and not a master of anyone
I really wanna get back into mid main as I used to main ahri and brand mid back in s3or 4 but stopped playing for a few years

Ive started to que as mid and top as I wouldn't mind becoming good at
Mid.. ahri talon zed lux fizz
Top.. riven olaf nasus wukong

Today my main would be kennen hes the one champ I understand combos and weakness and strengths really well on but its hard to carry as kennen I find

Thats all fine and dandy.
I had to watch a B5 guy who mained top XD

his games weren't pretty either.

As long as you recognize your mistakes, trying to reach 80 CS per 10 mins.
Appropriate items for enemy teams, upgrading trinkets as soon as you reach LVL 9
warding, and counter warding.

Not chasing, getting objectives. 

Then you should be all fine.

I see these mistakes all too much
We 4 man killed right infront of mid inhib tower. . My team left to go do dragon instead
People get owned by someone.  Instead of getting magic resist or armor they stick to standard builds

We 5 manned at 30 mins.. instead of winning game team went to go do baron until I pinged the crap outta them
My teams never upgrade trinket and even with whole team having ward trinkets there's never wards

We killed all team but one.. instead of pushingthey chase tthrough jg and then decided to go push once everyone had spawned

I don't care so much about the afk or feeder as you can always win but I am so irritated that people call KS or chase through umwarded jungle or try to 2v5 with the support and the guy behind AND mostly the lack of awareness to get objectives or working as a team

They even go.. hmm noone is dead entire enemy team is missing they not baren or dragon so let's go do baren.. without warding and denying vision

Is saw the darius flashq ggame.  Man you were angry haha

I think a big issue forrme is I know not to go in as it bait but I get greedy

Yeah people in low elo believe Kills win games.
When its a whole lot of everything else.

In that Diana game I did recently the guy won the match because his ADC carried him, he protected and peeled for him and twitch did all the work.

And in one of my Gold promo games, I fed like 2/15? as Braum support.
But I stuck with someone and protected them.

--

People also think that they should go get camps or X instead of pushing for a real objective too, which is one of the biggest problems.
Make a video showing common mistakessand mmake everyone watch it

I was actually thinking of creating another series called "Why X"
like "Why you are bronze" and etc, im fuckign filled with ideas but im lazy and my net sucks XD

Just do it! Yesterday you said tomorrow
Just make your dreams come true
Just do it

LOL.

yeah but I dont know how to script it.

Now that I think about it, I guess I don't script it.
My best work is improvised on the spot.

its a lot better to just watch pro games (LCS, LCK, LPL, not opl). the casters mainly talk about high level play that you may never replicate but, especially in LCS, which i watch the most, theres still a lot of mistakes that happen or respect not being given in which the opponents can capitalise and the casters can point it out and you can understand how to respect each aspect of a teams play. you'll learn a lot from watching them if you really want to

yeah I can look into this for you.
I mean I know a guy, hes not perfect. But hes genuine.

Hes a bit weird tho, calls himself "The Acolyte Of Shurima"

but he means well, hes done a few vids. Working on getting better.
And hes helped out a few.

In fact, he just created a chat room so he could help out more people.
Or a "Club" when that comes about.

Helping Others Improve

^Is what the Chat/Club is called.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gegaIKI1dvo <- One source i found whilst conducting a rather quick search!
Just type up on the good 'ol Google or YouTube: spectate bronze with commentatary.
Good luck
